Configuration exporters¶

BaseExporter

Interface for configuration-exporting classes.

Cogli1Exporter

Export configurations to the cogli1 file format, used for visualisation purposes.

LAMMPSDataFileExporter

Export configurations to the LAMMPS data file format.
class baggianalysis.core.BaseExporter(self: baggianalysis.core.BaseExporter) → None¶

Interface for configuration-exporting classes.

The default constructor does not take any parameters.

write(self: baggianalysis.core.BaseExporter, arg0: baggianalysis.core.System, arg1: str) → None¶

Print out the configuration.

Parameters

  • system (System) – The System to be printed.

  • str_param (str) – A string that is be used by subclasses to construct the output filename.

class baggianalysis.core.Cogli1Exporter(*args, **kwargs)¶

Export configurations to the cogli1 file format, used for visualisation purposes.

Overloaded function.

  1. __init__(self: baggianalysis.core.Cogli1Exporter) -> None

    This constructor makes the exporter print each particle as a red sphere of radius 0.5.

  2. __init__(self: baggianalysis.core.Cogli1Exporter, arg0: Callable[[baggianalysis.core.Particle], str]) -> None

This constructor takes as a parameter a callable that maps each particle into a string that will be printed by the exporter.

Parameters

mapper (callable) – A callable that takes a particle and returns the corresponding cogli1 string.

write(self: baggianalysis.core.BaseExporter, arg0: baggianalysis.core.System, arg1: str) → None¶

Print out the configuration.

Parameters

  • system (System) – The System to be printed.

  • str_param (str) – A string that is be used by subclasses to construct the output filename.

class baggianalysis.core.LAMMPSDataFileExporter(self: baggianalysis.core.LAMMPSDataFileExporter, arg0: str, arg1: str) → None¶

Export configurations to the LAMMPS data file format.

This constructor requires two mandatory arguments.

Parameters

  • atom_style (string) – The atom style to be used in printing the data file (see here for details). As of now, only the “atomic” and “bond” styles are supported.

  • basename (string) – The prefix that will be used to build the filename of the output file. Can be empty.
